level.text: Remedies provided by this chapter are cumulative and do not affect the availability of remedies under other law, including the recognition of a support order of a foreign country or political subdivision on the basis of comity.
Provide the exclusive method of establishing or enforcing a support order under the law of the District; or
Grant a tribunal of the District jurisdiction to render judgment or issue an order relating to child custody or visitation in a proceeding under this chapter.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 16-137 rewrote the section, which had read as follows:
"Remedies provided by this chapter are cumulative and do not affect the availability of remedies under other law."

level.heading: Legislative History of Laws
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 11-81, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 46-301.01.

level.heading: Effective Dates
level.text: Applicability: Section 3 of D.C. Law 16-137 provides: "This act shall apply as of April 1, 2007."

level.heading: Uniform Law
level.text: This section is based upon § 104 of the Uniform Interstate Family Support Act (2001 Act). See Volume 9, Part IB Uniform Laws Annotated, Master Edition, or ULA Database on Westlaw.
